BecometheOther.focus: Vinegar + lime + veggie oil combo testing

endlessness.contribution: Slow crystallization method documentation on wiki

contributions: Compendium for the Extraction of Jurema
amor_fati.philosophy: Food-safe, grocery store accessible extraction methods

downwardsfromzero.note: Identified soap formation risk with lye + oils

veggie_oil_extraction_theory.principle: Vegetable oils can serve as non-polar solvents for alkaloid extraction, similar to how limonene or naphtha work
advantages: Can be combined with limonene to extend expensive solvent

soy_oil.results: Produces pale, fluffy extract easy to scrape

olive_oil.results: More powdery, less oily than soy; orangish-pink color

sunflower_oil.results: Works but may have freezing complications

veggie_oil_extraction_theory.key_insight: Dual-solvent mixture of limonene and veggie-oil extends viability of insufficient limonene amounts, reducing costs substantially

limtek_overview.definition: Lime-based extraction technique using calcium hydroxide (pickling lime) instead of lye
why_lime_over_lye: Avoids soap formation (saponification) when using oils
No emulsion problems typical of wet lye teks
basic_process: Mix plant material with lime and minimal water to form 'bark dough'
Add heated veggie oil (or oil/limonene mix)
Stir to extract alkaloids into oil
Salt out alkaloids using FASW or vinegar

FASW_technique.purpose: Converts freebase alkaloids to fumarate salts, pulling them from oil into water layer
process: Oil layer gels/slushes while water layer freezes solid
Remove gelled oil (squeeze out if in plastic container)
Thaw water layer and evaporate to obtain fumarate crystals

results.from_pure_veggie_oil: Pale color, fairly fluffy, easy to scrape
results.from_pure_limonene: Flakey and sticky, tends to jump around when scraped
results.from_oil_limonene_mix: Far easier to scrape than pure limonene

vinegar_salting_alternative.discovery: Vinegar works for salting, at least with veggie oil/limonene mix
vinegar_salting_alternative.method: Distilled white vinegar diluted with water (approximately 1:5 ratio)
advantages: No need for specialty fumaric acid
Reduces acetic acid contamination when diluted

acetate_handling.technique: Repeated manual crystallization to expose acetates and release acetic acid
acetate_handling.optional_purification: Quick rinse with saturated sodium carbonate solution, then cold water rinse

vinegar_salting_alternative.significance: Enables fully grocery-store-sourced extraction with no specialty chemicals

freeze_precipitation.purpose: Separates polar and non-polar layers, breaks emulsions

observations.normal: Polar (water/vinegar) layer freezes solid, oil layer gels or becomes slushy
observations.occasional: Sometimes polar freezes while oil gels - still workable
observations.handling: Shake and squeeze out slushy oil from plastic container, or scoop from glass

troubleshooting.emulsions: Freezing quells emulsions; partial freezing may help
troubleshooting.residual_oil: IPA wash cleans residual oil from frozen polar layer

IPA_washing.discovery: IPA (isopropyl alcohol) not very soluble in veggie oil but reduces its viscosity
uses: Clean residual oil from frozen polar layer
Clean up acetates without losing product
Even 90% IPA works - water content separates when mixed with salts
IPA_washing.alternative: Light limonene wash followed by IPA

wet_tek_warnings.problem: Using lye (NaOH) with oils causes saponification (soap formation)
symptoms: Gray, sparkly layer instead of expected oil color
Creamy middle layer between oil and aqueous
wet_tek_warnings.prevention: Use lime-based teks (limtek) instead of lye-based wet teks
wet_tek_warnings.salvage: If soap forms, freezing and careful separation may still recover product

biodiesel_connection.theory: Ethyl esters (biodiesel) may work as extraction solvents
observations: Biodiesel has excellent solvent properties (frees rusty parts, etc.)
Glycerine substituted for alcohol changes properties vs pure veggie oil
ASTM spec biodiesel is methyl ester processed with NaOH and methanol
Ethyl esters can be made with KOH or even hardwood potash
biodiesel_connection.recommendation: Use virgin vegetable oil (inexpensive) rather than recycled - fewer impurities
biodiesel_connection.unknown: Whether glycerine leg of triglyceride helps or hinders extraction

practical_tips.stirring: Keep material in jar for stirring, decant through THP (turkey baster/pipette)
practical_tips.filtering: Use lighter filtering for cleaner product
practical_tips.multiple_pulls: Keep performing flushes - with THP employment, everything drains eventually
practical_tips.yield_factors: Depends mainly on quality of basification (adequate lime, water, stirring)
practical_tips.container_choice: HDPE plastic jugs work well - can squeeze out gelled oil
practical_tips.limonene_conservation: Limonene diluted with veggie oil less prone to dissolving plastics

oil_limonene_mix.extract_quality: Less pure but wider range of molecules
oil_limonene_mix.appearance: Easier to work with than pure limonene

related_threads: The Poor Mans Tek - A 100% Fat Free, Food Safe, Grocery Store Solution to DMT Extraction
amor_fati's Nontoxic Approach to the Extraction of DMT
No d-Limo, No NP Solvent, No Acetone, All-Natural Extraction?

BecometheOther_friend.method: Veggie oil + vinegar + lime, freebased via oven heat
BecometheOther_friend.experience: Transported to temple/pyramid structure with Mayan/Incan theme, surrounded by waterfalls coming down walls

experience_reports.comparison_to_naphtha: Friend reported veggie oil extract 'just as good as the other spice made with naphtha'

chacruna_considerations.n_oxide_issue: Chacruna may have most DMT in N-oxide form
chacruna_considerations.implications: Sodium carbonate paste method only pulls freebase, leaving 90% of N-oxide behind

solutions.ammonia_freebasing: Use ammonia (gaseous base) to freebase N-oxide
solutions.zinc_reduction: Zinc in acidic environment converts N-oxide to freebase
solutions.limtek_advantage: No polar layer in limtek may allow N-oxides to be pulled in oil flush

vinegar_issues.problem_discovered: ALL tested vinegar brands leave impurities that gum up product
symptoms: Dry powder clogs smoking device airflow

brands_tested.heinz_distilled_white: Failed - same impurities when evaporated straight

vinegar_issues.theory: Impurities added after distillation - unclear why
vinegar_issues.acetone_wash: May filter out some impurities but results inconsistent
vinegar_issues.IPA_drytek: Did not adequately purify - product still had awful smell and was too hydroscopic
vinegar_issues.conclusion: amor_fati 'threw in the towel' on vinegar as salting reagent
vinegar_issues.potential_solution: Home distillation of vinegar might work but impractical

glacial_acetic_acid_solution.method: Salt with water + small amount of glacial acetic acid instead of vinegar
glacial_acetic_acid_solution.result: No detectable hint of residual acetic acid, very nice familiar odor
glacial_acetic_acid_solution.experience_report: Some of the best visuals yet, most satisfying session in a while
glacial_acetic_acid_solution.advantage: Quickest way to achieve smokable product straight from extraction
glacial_acetic_acid_solution.note: q21q21's instincts on acetate approach confirmed correct
glacial_acetic_acid_solution.recommendation: Forgo vinegar, use glacial acetic acid OR stick with fumaric acid

final_recommendations.alternative: Glacial acetic acid - works well, quickest method
final_recommendations.note: Fumaric acid is cheap to order online

sodium_carbonate_freebasing.problem: Spiceman's tek calls for 1/3 as much sodium carb as acidic water
sodium_carbonate_freebasing.result: Massive excess sodium carbonate after evaporation
sodium_carbonate_freebasing.issue: Sodium carb absorbs acetone, won't release it - lose yield
sodium_carbonate_freebasing.observation: More of a PULL than a wash due to quantity

alternatives.heat_dissociation: Freebase via heat in food dehydrator or oven
alternatives.manual_crystallization: amor_fati's method with minimal sodium carb

BecometheOther.method: Lime + veggie oil + vinegar, heat freebase

Curiouskid.note: Low potency reported - possibly technique issues

amor_fati_shoddy.note: Even with inadequate lime and shredded (not powdered) bark, still achieved smokable product
amor_fati_shoddy.conclusion: Wide threshold for error - simplification improves quality

Extra_Virgin_Delight.creator: logos2012
Extra_Virgin_Delight.note: Named because first users were 'virgins' to smoking DMT

process: Mix with saturated sodium carbonate solution
Freeze and thaw water to recover remaining crystals

harm_reduction_notes.legal_status: DMT is a controlled substance in most jurisdictions
harm_reduction_notes.purpose_of_documentation: Historical record of harm reduction community research
harm_reduction_notes.safety: All extraction involves chemical handling risks - proper safety equipment essential
harm_reduction_notes.context: DMT-Nexus community focused on harm reduction and responsible research
